title: Increasing sequence
description:
Given a positive integer k (3<=k<=15), one can generate an increasing sequence with the sum of kn. For example, when k=3, the sequence is

1,3,4,9,10,12,13,...

which is equivalent to

30, 31, 30+31, 32, 30+32, 31+32, 30+31+32,....


You are asked to find the Nth term of this sequence.
input: One line contains k and N with a blank. 3<=k<=15, 10<=N<=1000.
output: The value of the Nth term. The result is less than 2.1*109
author: Chapt 10
